meanings.sent1: I heard a loud pop when the balloon burst.
meanings.sent2: The pop of the firecracker startled me.
meanings.sent3: The pop of the bubble wrap made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The pop of the champagne cork signaled the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The pop of the popcorn in the microwave filled the room with a delicious smell.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, sharp sound
meanings.sent1: She tried to pop the bubble with her finger.
meanings.sent2: The balloon popped loudly when she pricked it.
meanings.sent3: He likes to pop the bubble wrap for fun.
meanings.sent4: The cork popped out of the bottle with a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The toaster popped the bread up when it was done.

meanings.definition: To put something into one's mouth
meanings.sent1: He likes to pop candies into his mouth.
meanings.sent2: She popped a grape into her mouth and smiled.
meanings.sent3: The baby tried to pop everything into his mouth.
meanings.sent4: He popped a piece of chocolate into his mouth and savored the taste.
meanings.sent5: She popped a mint into her mouth to freshen her breath.

meanings.definition: To open something quickly and suddenly
meanings.sent1: She popped the lid off the jar with ease.
meanings.sent2: He popped the top of the can to drink the soda.
meanings.sent3: The surprise made her pop the box open quickly.
meanings.sent4: He popped the lock on the suitcase to reveal the contents.
meanings.sent5: She popped the balloon to see what was inside.

meanings.definition: Popular music characterized by a catchy melody
meanings.sent1: She enjoys listening to upbeat pop music.
meanings.sent2: The radio station plays a lot of pop songs.
meanings.sent3: The catchy pop tunes always make her dance.
meanings.sent4: Pop music is known for its catchy hooks and rhythms.
meanings.sent5: The concert was filled with fans of pop music.
